com.crickettechnology.audio

Class Mixer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.crickettechnology.audio.Mixer

  • public class Mixer
extends java.lang.Object
    A mixer represents a hierarchical grouping of sounds for controlling volumes.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void destroy()
      Destroy this object.
      static Mixer find(java.lang.String name)
      Finds a mixer by name.
      static Mixer getMaster()
      Returns the master mixer, which is the root of the mixer hierarchy.
      boolean getMixedPauseState()
      Returns true if this mixer, or any of its ancestors, is paused.
      float getMixedVolume()
      Returns the volume used for mixing (affected by ancestors).
      java.lang.String getName()
      Returns the name of the mixer.
      Mixer getParent()
      Returns the parent of the mixer.
      float getVolume()
      Get the volume of this mixer.
      boolean isPaused()
      Get whether this mixer is paused.
      static Mixer newMixer(java.lang.String name)
      Creates a new mixer.
      static Mixer newMixer(java.lang.String name, Mixer parent)
      Creates a new mixer.
      void setName(java.lang.String name)
      Sets the name of the mixer.
      void setParent(Mixer parent)
      Sets the parent of the mixer.
      void setPaused(boolean paused)
      Set whether this mixer is paused.
      void setVolume(float volume)
      Set the volume of this mixer.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • setName

        public void setName(java.lang.String name)
        Sets the name of the mixer.
        Parameters:
        name - The name; should be 31 characters or less.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of the mixer. The name will be 31 characters or less.

      • setVolume

        public void setVolume(float volume)
        Set the volume of this mixer. (The actual volume used during mixing will also depend on ancestors.)

      • getVolume

        public float getVolume()
        Get the volume of this mixer. (The actual volume used during mixing will also depend on ancestors.)

      • getMixedVolume

        public float getMixedVolume()
        Returns the volume used for mixing (affected by ancestors).

      • setPaused

        public void setPaused(boolean paused)
        Set whether this mixer is paused. A sound will be paused if the sound, its mixer, or any of its mixer's ancestors are paused.

      • isPaused

        public boolean isPaused()
        Get whether this mixer is paused. A sound will be paused if the sound, its mixer, or any of its mixer's ancestors are paused.

      • getMixedPauseState

        public boolean getMixedPauseState()
        Returns true if this mixer, or any of its ancestors, is paused.

      • setParent

        public void setParent(Mixer parent)
        Sets the parent of the mixer. Setting to null sets the master mixer as the parent.

      • getParent

        public Mixer getParent()
        Returns the parent of the mixer. The return value is null only for the master mixer.

      • getMaster

        public static Mixer getMaster()
        Returns the master mixer, which is the root of the mixer hierarchy.

      • newMixer

        public static Mixer newMixer(java.lang.String name,
                             Mixer parent)
        Creates a new mixer. The initial volume of the mixer is 1.0.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the mixer; should be 31 characters or less
        parent - The mixer's parent; if null, parent will be the master mixer

      • newMixer

        public static Mixer newMixer(java.lang.String name)
        Creates a new mixer. The mixer is parented to the master mixer, and its initial volume is 1.0.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the mixer; should be 31 characters or less

      • find

        public static Mixer find(java.lang.String name)
        Finds a mixer by name.
        Parameters:
        name - The mixer name; should be 31 characters or less
        Returns:
        The mixer, or null if none with that name

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Destroy this object. This is called when the object is finalized by the garbage collector; however, it is better to call it explicitly, so the object is destroyed predictably.
